newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Aokam debt put on rating watch - RAM.
newsitem.headline: Aokam debt put on rating watch - RAM.

text.p: The debt of logging concern Aokam Perdana Bhd was put on a ratings watch with the possibility of a downgrade following the company's report of a loss for its financial year, Rating Agency Malaysia Bhd (RAM) said on Wednesday.
RAM said in a statement the rating concerned Aokam's 50.6 million ringgit redeemable unsecured loan stock, which are bonds convertible into stock.
The company's loan stocks were downgraded on August 10 to A2 from a previous long-term rating of AA3.
Aokam on Monday reported a pre-tax loss of 145.07 million ringgit for the year ended June 30, 1996, versus a profit of 45.68 million ringgit a year ago.
RAM noted that Aokam's pre-tax loss for the half-year to December 1995 had been reported at 6.23 million ringgit.
"RAM notes that 57 percent of the loss is the result of provisioning and write-offs," RAM said in its statement.

"The rating watch also reflects the worsening trend in the group's financial performance and RAM's expectations of a slow recovery in demand and prices for timber products in the international market over the immediate term," RAM said.
RAM said these factors would significantly change Aokam's cashflow position, "which is expected to remain tight over the bond issue period".
It added that it is currently seeking details on the recently announced results from Aokam management.
Aokam's net loss of 144.73 million ringgit far exceeded market expectations of an eight to 10 million ringgit loss.
